content: bear written by kim ethridge this pattern was created for the intended purpose of making donatable items for the bsa wood badge fundraiser i give permission to freely make items from this pattern to sell or donate or for personal use i only ask that you please help me keep this pattern free and available for its intended use by not selling or claiming the pattern as your own please feel free to contact me at ethridge101@yahoo com with questions just like with live animals no individual piece is exactly alike the pictures are for guidance only for pieces worked in the round i recommend the use of a stitch marker making sure to move it up each round as you go when stuffing take time to shape each piece adding or subtracting to achieve desired results i also recommend pinning your pieces in place before stitching this helps immensely when determining correct placement notes yarn worsted weight in brown dark brown tan and black hook size g or similarly sized hook to make stitches tight enough that your stuffing won t show other supplies stitch marker yarn or tapestry needle gauge not important for this project project size roughly 6 tall and 12 long stitches used chain chain st stitch slip_stitch slip_stitch single_crochet single_crochet decrease single_crochet decrease single_crochet 2 stitches together magic_ring -
